page.title: 01Scarinish & Gott Bay Tiree
page.content: Gott Bay sweeps in a horse shoe for almost 5 km the sands are silvery and the sea is shallow suitable for bathing, small bats and windsurfing. Scarinish is the main village having the bank, Post office, Butcher, and co op. Co-op as well as good variety of food stock cosmetics furniture and most household requirements. Many of the houses are holiday homes. The land around the village and the bay is cultivated and fenced. Hay, rye, grass and barley are grown. Large stocks of beef cattle and sheep are raised. The land is very fertile. Generally it is windy but has many hours of sunshine. Gaelic is still spoken here.
